content: SummaryHow to activate Windows Server licensing using KMS.InstructionsSet Server EditionDISM /online /Set-Edition:ServerStandard /ProductKey:N69G4-B89J2-4G8F4-WWYCC-J464C /AcceptEulaInstall KMS Client Product keyslmgr /ipk N69G4-B89J2-4G8F4-WWYCC-J464CSet KMS Serverslmgr.vbs -skms kms8.msguides.comActivate Windowsslmgr.vbs /ato

content: SummaryHow to use PowerShell for connecting to Remote Computers.Requirements Command Prompt (CMD or Windows Terminal)InstructionsList PowerShell SessionsGet-PSSessionCreate PowerShell Session to remote computer.New-PSSession -ComputerName namehereEnter PowerShell sessions to remote computer.Enter-PSSession -ComputerName namehereDelete PowerShell session to remote computer.Remove-PSSession -ComputerName namehere

title: CertUtil
snippet: SummaryHow to use Windows CertUtil for managing certificates.Requirements Command Prompt (CMD or Windows Terminal)InstructionsWorking with Certificate TemplatesList templatescertutil -CATemplates ...
content: SummaryHow to use Windows CertUtil for managing certificates.Requirements Command Prompt (CMD or Windows Terminal)InstructionsWorking with Certificate TemplatesList templatescertutil -CATemplates -Config Request cert against templatecertreq -attrib "CertificateTemplate:WebServer"Certificate Authority Database CleanupType of records: Name Description Type of date Request Failed and pending certificates Submission date Cert Expired and revoked certificates Expiration date CRL CRL table Expiration date Request - Delete all failed and pending requests submitted by December 30th 2018Certutil -deleterow 30/12/2019 RequestCert - Delete all expired and revoked certificates expired by December 30th, 2018Certutil -deleterow 30/12/2018 CertCRL - Delete all CRLs that expired by January 1st, 2017Certutil -deleterow 01/01/2017 CRL

title: Docker Install & Configure
snippet: SummaryRequirements Linux SSH Terminal (Putty or Windows Terminal)InstructionsInstall Docker & Docker Composesudo apt install docker.io docker-composeGeneral Commandsdocker psdocker stop cont...
content: SummaryRequirements Linux SSH Terminal (Putty or Windows Terminal)InstructionsInstall Docker & Docker Composesudo apt install docker.io docker-composeGeneral Commandsdocker psdocker stop container namedocker start container namedocker restart container namedocker inspect container nameDocker Compose defaultsmkdir project namecd project namedocker-compose up -ddocker-compose downDocker Compose specify filenamedocker-compose -f filename.yaml up -dDocker Compose file with re-create commanddocker-compose -f filename.yaml up -d --force-recreateNetworkingList docker networksdocker network lsCreate docker networkdocker network create name --attachableDocker ImagesList docker imagesdocker image lsUpdate a docker imagedocker pull imagenameRemove docker imagedocker image rm imagename

title: Windows 11 TPM Bypass
snippet: SummaryHow to bypass TPM Requirements for Windows 11.Requirements Windows 11 (console access)Instructions Press Shift + F10 A DOS box appears. Typ regedit and hit enter Navigate to HKEY_LOCAL_M...
content: SummaryHow to bypass TPM Requirements for Windows 11.Requirements Windows 11 (console access)Instructions Press Shift + F10 A DOS box appears. Typ regedit and hit enter Navigate to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\Setup and create a new Key named LabConfig Create in the LabConfig Key a ByPassTPMCheck DWORD (32-bit) with the value of 1 Close the Regedit window (click on the Red X in the right corner) Type exit to leave the command prompt Click on the Red X in the right corner and the setup will start again

title: Tautulli Install & Configure
snippet: SummaryHow to install Tautulli on a Linux Debian/Ubuntu operating system via Git method.Original instructions taken from the Tautulli Githubhttps://github.com/Tautulli/Tautulli/wiki/Installation#li...
content: SummaryHow to install Tautulli on a Linux Debian/Ubuntu operating system via Git method.Original instructions taken from the Tautulli Githubhttps://github.com/Tautulli/Tautulli/wiki/Installation#linuxRequirements Linux machine (Debian 11/Ubuntu) SSH Terminal (Putty or Windows Terminal)InstructionsInstall Tautuilli step by stepStep 1 - prerequisitessudo apt-get install git python3 python3-setuptools python3-opensslStep 2 - Change to /opt directory and clone Tautullicd /optsudo git clone https://github.com/Tautulli/Tautulli.gitStep 3 - Configure the Tautull user & update install folder ownershipsudo addgroup tautulli && sudo adduser --system --no-create-home tautulli --ingroup tautullisudo chown -R tautulli:tautulli /opt/TautulliStep 4 - Create, enable & start the Tautulli service.sudo cp /opt/Tautulli/init-scripts/init.systemd /lib/systemd/system/tautulli.servicesudo systemctl daemon-reload && sudo systemctl enable tautulli.servicesudo systemctl start tautulli.serviceStep 5 - Accessing your Tautulli via browser: http://localhost:8181TroubleshootingEnabling SSL fails or keeps reverting after enabling, ensure the Python3 OpenSSL tools are installed these are required to enable SSL.sudo apt-get install python3-openssl

title: Debian Setup & Configure
snippet: SummaryHow to configure a Debian operating system to be ready for use, post-OS install.Requirements Debian Linux (lightweight install) SSH Terminal (Putty or Windows Terminal)InstructionsInitial ...
content: SummaryHow to configure a Debian operating system to be ready for use, post-OS install.Requirements Debian Linux (lightweight install) SSH Terminal (Putty or Windows Terminal)InstructionsInitial configStep 1 - Ensure all sources and packages are fully updated.apt-get updateapt-get upgradeStep 2 - Install sudo package.apt-get install sudoStep 3 (optional) - Enable SSH for root accountsudo nano /etc/ssh/sshd_configuncomment and edit theline "PermitRootLogin yes"Configure Static IP Addresssudo nano /etc/network/interfacesedit the line: iface ens192 inet staticaddress 192.168.0.1netmask 255.255.255.0gateway 192.168.0.254dns-nameservers 192.168.0.254Add Root CA CertsCopy all CA certs to: /usr/local/share/ca-certificates/update-ca-certificateConfigure NTP SettingsInstall NTP Clientsudo apt install ntpEdit NTP Configsudo nano /etc/ntp.confadd line to config file:server 192.168.0.254 prefer iburstCheck NTP statusntpq -p

title: Debian Configure Firewall
snippet: SummaryHow to configure the Debian firewall UFWRequirements Debian Linux (lightweight install) SSH Terminal (Putty or Windows Terminal)InstructionsInstall Firewall package.sudo apt install ufwEna...
content: SummaryHow to configure the Debian firewall UFWRequirements Debian Linux (lightweight install) SSH Terminal (Putty or Windows Terminal)InstructionsInstall Firewall package.sudo apt install ufwEnable UFW Firewallufw enableFirewall Statusufw status verboseCheck log in realtimetail -f /var/log/ufw.logConfigure Firewall PoliciesDefault policy creationufw allow sshufw default deny incomingAllow rule from IP and portufw allow from 15.15.15.0/24 to any port 22Block from IPufw deny from 61.177.172.114/32 to anyDeleting rulesufw delete allow 80ufw delete allow 443
